titles.title: A bill for the relief of Fleurette Seidman.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Courts and Administrative Practice.
Subcommittee on Courts and Administrative Practice. Approved for full committee consideration without amendment favorably.

calendar.text: Committee on Judiciary. Ordered to be reported with an amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Judiciary. Reported to Senate by Senator Biden with an amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 1072.

action.text: Indefinitely postponed by Senate by Unanimous Consent.

bill.summary: 10/6/1987--Introduced. Directs the Secretary of the Treasury to pay to a named individual a specified sum representing the losses and expenses she incurred arising out of her voluntary termination of Federal employment in good faith reliance on erroneous information regarding her eligibility for a retirement annuity.
